summary: SAFV is a small non-enveloped virus with a single-stranded RNA of about 8,050 nucleotides. the virus name traces back to the name of the first author of the original description. the virus was found in feces from Asian children with non-polio acute flaccid paralysis [9] and in cerebrospinal fluid specimens of patients with aseptic meningitis [12, 20–21]. TMEV is known to cause a multiple sclerosis (MS)-like syndrome in mice [21]. ii) reports failing to detect SAFV in samples from diseased patients. adenoid tissue samples were obtained from 70 patients consecutively admitted for adenoidectomy. all patients had clinical symptoms caused by hypertrophy of adenoids. at the time of surgery and the 2 weeks before, no children displayed symptoms of acute upper or lower airway infection. RT-PCR was performed in a volume of 25 L containing 5 L RNA preparation (approximately 1.25 mg) RT and cycling conditions were 52°C for 20 min, denaturation at 94°C for 3 min, followed by 45 PCR cycles. the PCR amplified a 187-bp fragment of the SAFV genome within the 5 untranslated region (5 UTR) RT and cycling conditions were as follows: 48°C for 30 min, 95°C for 5 min, 35 cycles each consisting of 95°C for 1 min, 50°C for 1 min, 72°C for 1 min, followed by 72°C for 5 min. nested PCR, 95°C for 3 min, 35 cycles (94°C for 1 min, 60°C for 1 min, 72°C for 1 min, 72°C for 1 min), 72°C for 5 min. tested viruses were Influenza A and B viruses, Human parainfluenza viruses 1–4 (now termed Human respiroviruses 1 and 3, Human rubulaviruses 2 and 4), Human Rhinovirus, Human respiratory syncytial virus, Human metapneumovirus, Enterovirus, Human parechovirus and Human coronaviruses 229E, NL63, HKU-1, and OC43, and human adenovirus. sequence analysis Extirpated adenoids were picked up in the surgical room and transported on ice to the laboratory for immediate preparation. the lysate was homogenized by using QIAshredder homogenizer spin columns (Qiagen) according to manufacturer s instructions. lified a 187-bp fragment of the SAFV genome within the 5 untranslated region (5 UTR) the limit of detection 95% (LOD95) was 9 copies per reaction. samples tested positive were subjected to nested RT-PCR. amplified products were visualized on agarose gels and subjected to DNA cycle sequencing using BigDye Terminator technology.
